messages: 8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:00): in this c ase byte(cards[x+1]-2)
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:00): in this c ase (byte)(cards[x+1]-2)
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:00): Just be aware that it'll mess up if the value goes outside of 0-255
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:00): cause byte is unsigned.
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:01): it wont. but cant understand why it does not work as is. byte is numeric after all
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:01): Any time you do math, it gets converted up to an int
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:01): so you have      byte = byte - int
65b5cc66157b321c91125b1928dc9f72 (02:01): how can i return an array after sql data reader object ?
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:02): so would it be better if I defined the variables as int rather than byte
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:02): All types default to int unless casted.
65b5cc66157b321c91125b1928dc9f72 (02:02): i'm reading data via sqldatareader and i want to set results to an array
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:02): It's more common.
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:02): I see. I used byte to save memory as numbers are small
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:02): unless you have a lot (getting into the thousands+ range) I usually use ints over bytes.
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:02): but looks like int is better
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:03): I see. ok.
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:03): thanks
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:03): routine  COpy it out one line at a time.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:03): routine  You don't know much about the reader before it starts... you don't know the max number of entries, etc..
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:04): You only know the rowcount at the end.
65b5cc66157b321c91125b1928dc9f72 (02:04): Kunnis yes.. isn't there a solution for this problem?

1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:04): one other q. I added a class file to my windows app. and wrote some functions in it. but I cant call those functions from my main windows form code. any idea why ?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:04): ArrayList.
65b5cc66157b321c91125b1928dc9f72 (02:04): do you advice it ?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:05): It works if you don't plan on returning too many rows.  Sometimes you'll want to create custom objects that represent the result of a row.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:07): Then return an array list or hashtable of it
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:08): Kunnis: any idea to my question ?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:08): Do you have an instance of the call?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:08): Err of the class?
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:09): ah. so I need to create the object first with new
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:09): Or mark the methods as static
1cae6f99efc1a33133123d3a59d9f8fc (02:09): ah ok. will try thanks.
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:22): i got a question. I want a user to have as many groups as possible. How can I store this?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:23): Cause I don't think you can create a row in a db from C#
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:23): As a cross join table.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:23): Yes you can
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:23): you can :S
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:23): Call ExecuteScaler() or ExecuteNonQuery()
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:24): Or ExecuteReader will work, but the reader.Read() will return null if there's no rows.
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:25): is that a way to have it done is create a table for that user and when a user joins a group it inserts a new row permantly. ugh im so stupid
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:25): how do I pop up a dialog box, ie "error: invalid move"
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:26): Have a talbe that's Users [UserID, Username] and Groups [GroupId, Groupname]   and a USerGroups [USerId,GroupID]
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:26): You can see what users are in a group by select UserID from UserGroups where GroupID = X, and the same for which groups a user iis a member of.
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:27): Kunnis, yeah i have an example like that in my book
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:27): mdfedderly  Popping up dialog boxes is considered bad UI design, but MessageBox.Show()
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:27): Cross Join tables are handy.
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:27): Kunnis: why are they considered bad ui design?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:27): But then what about the total users for that group
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:28): select count(userId) from usergroups where groupid = whatever
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:28): its so confusing to me >.<
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:29): not what your saying
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:29): I suppose I could learn threading
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:30): how hard is it to get a few simple threads?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:30): so many inn joins imma have to do
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:30): like set statusbox, wait, set status box again
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:30): It gets ugly with windowsForms.
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:30): Kunnis, me?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:30): You have to Invoke on the main thread.
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:30): I have a better idea
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:30): purely event-driven
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:30): I can just do Illegal Move : White Turn
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:30): or something
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:30): Shin-Ra  Google for cross join tables.
1a8584f0c647c17aae7f5aca0ae61686 (02:30): thanks Kunnis
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:31): okay thanks
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:31): When a user makes an illegal move, move the piece back, and display a message on the screen, not a popup.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:32): Look at it relationally
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (02:32): do MessageBox.Show()

8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:32): Have a table that's Users [UserID, Username] and Groups [GroupId, Groupname]   and a UserGroups [USerId,GroupID]  If a user joins a group, put an entry into that table.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:33): Shin-Ra  MessageBox.Show is bad UI deisgn.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:33): If you're just doing somethng for fun, MessageBox.Show will work, but it's better to display an error message on screen.
